quotes.text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: To conquer oneself is a greater task than conquering others.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The trouble is, you think you have time.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: There is no path to happiness: happiness is the path.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: In the end, only three things matter: how much you loved, how gently you lived, and how gracefully you let go of things not meant for you.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Your work is to discover your work and then with all your heart to give yourself to it.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: If you light a lamp for somebody, it will also brighten your path.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: To understand everything is to forgive everything.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Do not overrate what you have received, nor envy others. He who envies others does not obtain peace of mind.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: It is a man's own mind, not his enemy or foe, that lures him to evil ways.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Resolutely train yourself to attain peace.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Everything that has a beginning has an ending. Make your peace with that and all will be well.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: If we could see the miracle of a single flower clearly, our whole life would change.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Believe nothing, no matter where you read it, or who said it, no matter if I have said it, unless it agrees with your own reason and your own common sense.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The truth is not always beautiful, nor beautiful words the truth.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The tongue like a sharp knife... Kills without drawing blood.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: In a controversy the instant we feel anger we have already ceased striving for the truth, and have begun striving for ourselves.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: To keep the body in good health is a duty... otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Every human being is the author of his own health or disease.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Without health life is not life; it is only a state of languor and suffering - an image of death.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, not to worry about the future, or not to anticipate troubles, but to live in the present moment wisely and earnestly.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: He who has health has hope, and he who has hope has everything.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The greatest wealth is health.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Your body is precious. It is our vehicle for awakening. Treat it with care.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Health is the greatest possession. Contentment is the greatest treasure. Confidence is the greatest friend. Non-being is the greatest joy.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Your worst enemy cannot harm you as much as your own unguarded thoughts.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Meditate... do not delay, lest you later regret it.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Just as a snake sheds its skin, we must shed our past over and over again.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The past is already gone, the future is not yet here. There's only one moment for you to live.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: If with a pure mind a person speaks or acts, happiness follows them like a never-departing shadow.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: To understand everything is to forgive everything.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The root of suffering is attachment.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: In the sky, there is no distinction of east and west; people create distinctions out of their own minds and then believe them to be true.
quotes.author: Buddha
